overview:
Reid co-founded GroupLogic in 1988 and has served in a number of key executive roles since then including CEO, Chairman and President. Reid wields his more than 20 years of experience to help drive the strategic direction and growth of the company’s product lines, and works to ensure the success of customers who use the Company’s mobilEcho, ExtremeZ-IP and MassTransit solutions. To stay in touch with customer’s evolving requirements, Reid represents GroupLogic at industry conferences and in online communities related to GroupLogic’s products, customers’ successes and related technologies. As part of GroupLogic’s commitment to customer success, Reid leads the Enterprise Device Alliance (EDA) as its President. GroupLogic co-founded this market education organization in 2008 with other software vendors to help IT professionals learn how to deploy, secure and manage Macs, iPhones and iPads in Windows-IT environments.

As an active proponent of innovation, Reid co-chairs the The Duke Global Entrepreneurship Network (DukeGEN), which he co-founded in 2008, and serves on the Advisory Board of The Center for Entrepreneurship and Innovation (CEI) at Duke’s Fuqua School of Business.
